text: Yin Lihua (5 - 26 February 64 ADguimao day of the 1st month of the 7th year of the Yong'ping era, per Emperor Ming's biography in Book of the Later Han) was a ruler during the Eastern Han Dynasty. She was the second empress of Liu Xiu and was known for beauty and placability. == References == Category:5 births Category:64 deaths Category:Chinese royalty
title: Yin Lihua
